awd_titl_txt: Instrumentation for the Incorporation of Cell Culturing and Hybridoma Technology into an Undergraduate Biology Program
awd_abstract_narration: This project is designed to give undergraduate students an opportunity          to use new instrumentation for laboratory experimentation and research          projects in cell culturing, hybridoma technology, protein isolation and         characterization, and antigen-antibody analysis. The major instruments          purchased are laminar flow hoods, an inverted microscope, a CO2                 incubator, a liquid nitrogen storage tank, a centrifuge, an ELISA               reader and software, and gel electrophoresis equipment. These are to be         used primarily in a new cell biology course but also in existing                courses in invertebrate zoology, embryology, immunology, genetics and a         non-majors biology course. Independent study students can also utilize          it. The college will contribute an amount equal to the award.

inst.inst_name: Mount Saint Mary's College and Seminary
